, juvenile, G 1 , LV (C. O .F.L.S. 796 );
22–25 .
Evlanella peranensis Maillet
n. sp.
, tecnomorph ( 22 ), N 2 , LV (C. O .F.L.S. 799 ); holotype ( 23 ), tecnomorph, N 2 , LV (C. O .F.L.S. 800 ); paratype 1 ( 24 ), heteromorph, N 2 , LV (C. O .F.L.S. 1124 ); paratype 2 ( 25 ), juvenile, N 2 , LV (C. O .F.L.S. 1125 ).

Description. Medium-sized carapace. Slight overlap of the larger RV over the LV at free margins, especially ventrally. Hmax median; Lmax at about 1 / 4 dorsal; Wmax slightly posterior. Straight hinge line and dorsal margin. Anterior cardinal angle of about 100 °. Posterior cardinal angle of about 80 °. Anterior margin more widely rounded that the posterior one. Ventral margin regularly convex. Marginal flattening of the valves along free margins. Surface smooth. Lateral wing in the ventral part, between 1 / 2 and 2 / 3 of Lmax from anterior margin, pointing towards postero-ventral part.
Discussion. A species quite rare in the Givetian of Asturias by comparison with other regions such as Ardenne, Eifel or Bohemia .

Occurrence. Lower to Middle Givetian (Hanonet, Terres d’Haurs, Mont d’Haurs, Névremont Fms, and Fromelennes Fm, Flohimont Mb), Ardenne (Flohimont, Cul d’Houille, Mont d’Haurs, Resteigne, Couvin, Hotton, Aisemont and Aisne sections); Middle Givetian (Candás Fm, mb C), Asturias (Peran-Perlora section); Givetian, Boulonnais; Middle Devonian, Bohemia , Poland , Eifel and Ruhr.
